title: How to Make Peppermint Brownies

steps.headline: Assemble the ingredients listed above.
steps.description: Crush the peppermints. You can crush the peppermints or candy canes by using a kitchen mallet or pounding them with your hands. Crush them until they turn into small pieces.

steps.headline: Make your desired brownie batter as usual.
steps.description: Mix and add any ingredients mentioned in the instructions of the box. Make sure you mix thoroughly with a whisk. Then, add one cup of crushed regular peppermint candy canes or peppermints to the mix. Mix thoroughly with the whisk and pour the batter into either a nine by nine inch (23 x 23 centimeters) pan or eight by eight inch (20 x 20 centimeters) pan. Smooth out evenly.

steps.headline: Stick the peppermint brownie mix in the oven for the time it says on the box.
steps.description: While baking, clean up and put away any dishes and ingredients you're not using. Get out a medium sized bowl, a spoon, a knife, and a large plate.

steps.headline: Take the brownies out, using an oven mitt once they're done, and let cool for 5-7 minutes to set.
steps.description: Once cool, cut into size of your choice. Cut into bite size for sharing or larger sizes for a single family. Put on the plate.

steps.headline: Put one regular sized container of vanilla icing and about a teaspoon of peppermint extract in the bowl.
steps.description: Mix together with a spoon. Spread icing on top of brownies.

steps.headline: Take the rest of the crushed peppermint/candy canes and sprinkle them onto the icing.
steps.description: Make sure they stick well. Or, for another look, place a mini candy cane on each brownie.

steps.headline: Place of all the finished, delicious peppermint brownies onto a decorative serving platter and enjoy with your family and friends!

text: Assemble the ingredients listed above. Crush the peppermints. You can crush the peppermints or candy canes by using a kitchen mallet or pounding them with your hands. Crush them until they turn into small pieces. Make your desired brownie batter as usual. Mix and add any ingredients mentioned in the instructions of the box. Make sure you mix thoroughly with a whisk. Then, add one cup of crushed regular peppermint candy canes or peppermints to the mix. Mix thoroughly with the whisk and pour the batter into either a nine by nine inch (23 x 23 centimeters) pan or eight by eight inch (20 x 20 centimeters) pan. Smooth out evenly. Stick the peppermint brownie mix in the oven for the time it says on the box. While baking, clean up and put away any dishes and ingredients you're not using. Get out a medium sized bowl, a spoon, a knife, and a large plate. Take the brownies out, using an oven mitt once they're done, and let cool for 5-7 minutes to set. Once cool, cut into size of your choice. Cut into bite size for sharing or larger sizes for a single family. Put on the plate. Put one regular sized container of vanilla icing and about a teaspoon of peppermint extract in the bowl. Mix together with a spoon. Spread icing on top of brownies. Take the rest of the crushed peppermint/candy canes and sprinkle them onto the icing. Make sure they stick well. Or, for another look, place a mini candy cane on each brownie. Place of all the finished, delicious peppermint brownies onto a decorative serving platter and enjoy with your family and friends!
